Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2008 04:03PM - edited Sep 20, 2008 04:07PM by Hotmamamia Hey Aug27of2008, Your login was the date of my double mastectomy!  Anyway...I spent all day at home yesterday, either reading or watching TV or moving very slowly.  It made a big difference in the drainage amount.  I went from 85ml to 50 ml in one day!! I am following doctors orders and hopefully will get down to 30 ml soon.  Thank you to all comments regarding this issue.  I am no longer worried that I am some kind of freak!  Patience and rest is my best medicine, but sometimes a hard pill to swallow.

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2008 10:10AM Hotmamamia wrote: Sorry you are frustrated.  I am too!!  I have had my drain in for 3.5 weeks and still draining 65-75 ml a day.  I am worried about infection, so I wash the area everynight and rub a little antibacterial ointment around the hole. I went to the Dr. yesterday and he also told me I was doing too much.  It is hard to just lay around when you feel good.  He is not authorizing me to go back to work until the drain comes out...but I am tired of no activity, I walked 2.5 miles yesterday - I guess that was too much activity because you are moving your arms when you walk.  I can tell you that it is better to have the drain in than suffer the consequences.  When I had my sentinel node biopsy, I did not have a drain and I was miserable.  It was fine at first, but as soon as I went back to work, the fluid started collecting and I had severe swelling and pain under my arm and all the way down to my hand.  It looked like I had a baseball under my arm!!  I had to have it aspirated 3 times before I had my mastectomy.  Hang in there.  Slow down if possible.    Best to you!
